alert.note: Alert for Stokes (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 9:19PM EDT until September 05 at 2:15AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Thunderstorms with Heavy Rainfall Moving Through Western Stokes County... ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...Western Stokes County in North Central North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over some roadways especially in poor drainage and low-lying areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 916 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas may result in minor flooding for locations such as King, Pinnacle, Capella, and Francisco. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen and an additional 1 to 2 inches of rain is possible during the next 1 to 2 hours. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Archies Creek, Big Creek, Brushy Fork Creek, Danbury Creek, Cascade Creek, Crooked Run Creek, Chinquapin Creek and Dan River. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Francisco... Capella... Pinnacle... Collinstown... and Vade Mecum. - For additional information please go to http://www.weather.gov slash safety slash flood.
info.instruction: Precautionary Statements: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
